types.html:
louisianisation f (plural louisianisations)

  1. (Canada) the act or process of assimilation into the dominant language of the country to the detriment of the main historical language of a region, as happened historically in Louisiana
    • 2013 September 7, Louis Cornellier, “Les Québécois sont-ils condamnés à la servitude  ?”, Le Devoir.com:
      Les Payette, en ce sens, n’hésitent pas à évoquer une éventuelle louisianisation du Québec.
      The Payettes, in this sense, are not hesitant to bring up an eventual "Louisianization" of Quebec.
trans: the act or process of assimilation into the dominant language of the country to the detriment of the main historical language of a region, as happened historically in Louisiana
the act or process of assimilation into the dominant language of the country to the detriment of the main historical language of a region, as happened historically in Louisiana
the act or process of assimilation into the dominant language of the country to the detriment of the main historical language of a region, as happened historically in Louisiana

title: louisianisation
